documents.document: @elaine_vo Thank you Elaine! I feel so lucky to be working with this fantastic group of kids!

@storybreathing Had to share this with you. I am very blessed to be the "hero" to a student I taught last year. She made a collage of important things about our year last year - and of course, there you are! https://t.co/cWpABg7DoM
@dubioseducator Thank you Faige. That means so much to me - from your beautiful big heart!
@kyleredford Yes, that is what I hoped. Thank you for this.
@grubreport Thank you Stephanie
@kyleredford Thank you. I have been trying to decide if I had to tell this story and when it just wouldn't leave my thoughts, I knew I had to
Sunday Reflections: Tuesday Crying https://t.co/xPKrZX6hr9 It began with a read aloud and resulted in a whole lot of crying. Celebrating making space for emotions.
@dubioseducator @nikileech Thanks for sharing Faige!
Oh the @jesskeating love was big in my session! Also shared What Makes a Monster. Love those assassin bugs! https://t.co/7Ub874b3cc
@stephanie653117 Will do! I preordered it! SO should be arriving to me soon
@ExLibrisMrHunt And wow, that courtyard off your library! Just beautiful!
@nicbroz A pleasure!
@ExLibrisMrHunt Agreed! I did a lot of work with Island last year. Grade 4s and 5s became obsessed with Galapagos
@ExLibrisMrHunt Love You Are Stardust! It's on my wish list #youcantownthemall
@ExLibrisMrHunt Checking out your Instagram - great titles shared! Aren't Jason Chin's books amazing!? Thinking of using Grand Canyon in Mock Caldecott
@ExLibrisMrHunt Thx for sharing Don't know My Librarian is a Camel - love these kind of literacy stories from around the world!
@ExLibrisMrHunt Wonderful! Happy shopping!
@ExLibrisMrHunt Thanks so much for attending and for the feedback!
@annieteaches @PSASuperC2017 Happy to share Annie! Hope you enjoyed your conference!
@jnovakowski38 @PSASuperC2017 @BCPrimaryTeach Thanks Janice!
@judith_hardman My pleasure!
@kbegley2011 @PSASuperC2017 @nikileech @LoraSarchet Nothing organized at this point

Thanks for sharing! https://t.co/xJF2DKpVT5

@erringreg I am so pleased we got to meet in person! Thanks so much for attending today and for your support!

@nikileech I so appreciate all of these tweets and your support! Many thanks!

@nikileech @LoraSarchet Thanks so much for attending!
Wow @literacybigkids this post is wow. Pass the Mic https://t.co/5yIdsUBerf Just keep reading it and smiling larger and larger
Loved this post by @karianneholt on #nerdybookclub today https://t.co/N3aW0XipoK Can't wait to read Knock Out, companion to House Arrest
Don’t bother us. We’re reading Princess in Black @haleshannon #kidsarereading https://t.co/tvRULTWOXs
@schnare_s Beautiful! I want one or a million
Set everybody up and then read to them #letthemplay https://t.co/Q6R0ue3bIA
Sharing progress on my #mustreadin2017 list Fall update: https://t.co/4aJowYvd88
@judith_hardman @schnare_s @deltasd37 So great!
@LoraSarchet Always collecting these!
Lovely to have this room full of students and learning today! https://t.co/R2442tkjAS
So now Alvin has some support @lenorelook I think there are some major pep talks happening here https://t.co/C4lXGPi3SE
@VickiVintonTMAP Rooting around in our messy, upset thoughts to put something together like this for others is full of lots of generosity Vicki. Thank you.
Teachers, read this. Follow all the links. Sit and think. Then read it again. https://t.co/WfF8dkAHlZ
@schnare_s @MrsHardersClass It has inspired outdoor walks and filling our nature table with fall collections!
@schnare_s @MrsHardersClass Absolutely! It is a stunner.
@MrsHardersClass It is such a wonderful title! Enjoy

Our mini lessons in Reading Workshop have focussed on accessing background knowledge and then figuring out missing words using these questions: Does it make sense? Does it sound right? #rwworkshop https://t.co/0T93QiXWgq
So much excitement about making these books today! https://t.co/gJlVr4xbmo
@MaryAnnReilly I know! I am still smiling about this one.
Morning math explorations with @CuriosityRacers https://t.co/M30FTZvfox

We brainstormed what we noticed about these titles from the fantasy picture book bin. My favourite comment? "They have characters and creatures that are real if you believe in them." https://t.co/f4e87cJPF4
@elaine_vo - using a class twitter account now too! Follow @CuriosityRacers
How many tally marks in a minute? So many things and ways to count! https://t.co/26XpIYT3vB
Gorgeous books to celebrate the changing seasons for #classroombookaday https://t.co/0QRlXTKFHb
Whole school play afternoon on Friday. Lovely way to build community! Structures and building in our room https://t.co/Qie3AvgfvN
@dotmarwat @awilks98 Oh dear. Thinking more of books that promote community and neighbourhood and making them beautiful like Maybe Something Beautiful (Campoy) and Something Beautiful (Wyeth)
Sending the message that math is a painful struggle is not the message my students need to hear. Their math associations need to be about excitement, joy, challenge, inquiry, curiosity, discovery.

Hey World Please don't come into my classroom when we are engaged in a math activity and comment how you aren't good at math or that this is good for you even if you aren't good at math. We are mathematicians. This language does not compute.
@LisaSchwartz05 @mcneelyelem One of my favourite books!
We had so much fun exploring with new materials in math. Cuisenaire rods are the BEST!! https://t.co/GbNgD4Dg8U
Our #DotDay2018 art is pretty spectacular! Love that this baby #sibling all dressed in dots thought so too https://t.co/lebR9eQusu
@literacybigkids @owpmu @TCRWP Love this Stacey! Hurrah for process!

@MrsSokolowski @knott_michele @alizateach @Kpteach5 @literacydocent We love the Lola Levine series - both her and her brother are huge soccer fans! Captain Awesome series has a title called Soccer Star and Soccer Show Off by Jake Maddox I think Kylie Jean series also has a soccer title
@MrsSokolowski @knott_michele @alizateach @Kpteach5 @literacydocent Baseball and football not really big things here in Canada like soccer is so I am not up on these sports books - sorry
@knott_michele @MrsSokolowski @alizateach @Kpteach5 @literacydocent My response would be the same - The "Get a Hit, Mo" title - there is also a Pete the Cat early reader about baseball.
@akijae @CR4YC @ShBaatz @LoraSarchet @schnare_s @anniekinders @anniemiddles LOVED that one a lot! Read it multiple times
@akijae @CR4YC @ShBaatz @LoraSarchet @schnare_s @anniekinders @anniemiddles I go back again and again to Catching Readers Before They Fall and also Debbie Miller's Work
@elisabethelling Louisiana can absolultely be a stand alone
@schnare_s Thanks!
It's Monday! What are you reading? https://t.co/vClgaBtAcq #IMWAYR https://t.co/vWIJl6Ipem
@kellyyanghk I just spent the last 10 minutes sending messages to people about this being a MUST read title. Thank you for sharing so much of your story in Mia.
@dylanteut @Candlewick Okay phew, as I do too. In fact I right now want to go eat one of those 17 cakes with her and just listen to her talk.

Finished this one in one sitting: Lousiana's Way Home. There is room in your heart for Lousiana. Trust me. Such beautiful writing from the amazing #KateDiCamillo Releases October 2nd @Candlewick https://t.co/tEY3B3kpWA
Heard great things about middle grade novel Front Desk by @kellyyanghk? It's far BETTER than great! Highly recommend this one. https://t.co/5Ph8lud8TU
@jarhartz @varianjohnson @elisabethelling @erinvarley Clear a big space in your heart for these characters - they need some room!

@jarhartz @varianjohnson @elisabethelling @erinvarley Loved that one too! Recent reads I loved: Front Desk, Lousiana's Way Home, Ivy Aberdeen's Letter to the World (WOW!!!), The Truth about Mason Buttle, Ban this Book, Me and Marvin Gardens,
@joce63183749 I don't . . . But here is a link to this game: https://t.co/8e1lvtqLsG
@schnare_s What is that 2nd collection (not the shells)?
@agility2girl It'a a game called Gridlock - learning about plotting points on a grid and strategy involved to get 3 in a row
Math games on Friday afternoon = high engagement + lots of fun https://t.co/c0HEJu9p6w
Making #DotDay2018 art was a lot of fun! https://t.co/2Oq3eE5z7c

"Wow!! I found a big WOW!" #kidsarereading
@bibliosmartgirl I posted the letters outside of the room. Really special
@StuartShanker Frequently - usually just for about 5 minutes. That's all it took. It was the easiest thing with the largest impact.
@JoelSeaman I want to walk in duckling lines!
Such a powerful and personal post! https://t.co/JITybQBazf
"Try to make your friends laugh. Comedy is key." #DearNewStudents
"I hope you enjoy the class and love reading as much as me." #DearNewStudents
"If you are feeling sad or mad you can sit under the table with the cloth." #DearNewStudents
"If you are feeling distracted you can use headphones and you can use the bouncy seats too." #DearNewStudents
